questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with a complaint of dysmenorrhoea, dyspareunia with chronic pelvic pain undergoes hysterectomy. From the cut section of the hysterectomy specimen below identify the condition:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Adenomyosis

Highyeild:

Adenomyosis is a condition where there is ingrowth of the endometrium , both the glandular and stromal components, directly into the myometrium. It may be related to repeated childbirth, vigorous curettage or excess estrogen effect. There is a diffuse symmetrical enlargement of the uterus. Uterine endometriosis was observed frequently in elderly women, symmetrically enlarged around 14 weeks. The clinical symptoms of adenomyosis include menometrorrhagia (irregular and heavy menses), colicky dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and pelvic pain , particularly during the premenstrual period. There are foci of hemorrhagic cysts within the uterine wall. IOC is MRI. NSAIDs are commonly used to control pain and bleeding. Definitive treatment is surgical. The presence of functioning endometrium in sites other than uterine much is called endometriosis. Sites include ovaries, pelvic peritoneum, pouch of Douglas, uterosacral ligaments, umbilicus etc.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: Day 20 of the menstrual cycle falls under which phase?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Luteal phase

Highyeild:

The entire duration of a menstrual cycle can be divided into four main phases: Menstrual Phase (From Day 1 to 5) Follicular Phase (From Day 1 to 13) Ovulation Phase (Day 14) Luteal Phase (From Day 15 to 28)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and C are false.

questions.text: A 45-year-old female with 3 months’ menorrhagia. USG showing 2 cm submucosal fibroid. The first line of management is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Endometrial sampling

Highyeild:

Young Women Older Women Contraception Not desirable Contraception Desired ● Combined OCPs ● Progestogen and other hormones ● Mirena Rule out cancer & uterine pathology Progestogen Ethamsylate, NSAIDs Estrogen Tranexamic for 3 -4 months GnRH 3 - 4 months Effective Fails Normal uterus (DUB) Uterine Pathology Continue for 6 -9 Months Minimal invasive surgery Hysterectomy with conservation of ovaries Progestogen and others No response Hysterectomy with removal of ovaries after 50 Surgery

Extraedge:

Removal of an intrauterine contraceptive device if medical therapy fails. Myomectomy/hysterectomy for uterine fibroids. Wedge resection/hysterectomy for adenomyosis of the uterus. Dilatation and curettage with blood transfusion is the primary treatment of puberty menorrhagia with low Hb%. Multipara, a hypertensive woman with menorrhagia should be treated with MIRENA. Hysterectomy with or without removal of the adnexa according to the age and the individual needs of the patient.

questions.text: Presenting diameter of a fully flexed head is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sub occipito - bregmatic diameter

Highyeild:

Sub occipito - bregmatic diameter: The diameter is from the suboccipital region to the centre of the bregma. Diameter = 9.5 cm Fetal head circumference is the Head well/complete flexion. Sub-occipital-frontal diameter: The diameter is calculated from prominence at the mid-frontal bone to the under-surface of the occipital bone where it joins the The diameter is 10.5 cm. Vertex is partially deflexion/incomplete flexion. Occipito-frontal diameter: Diameter extends from the prominent point of the mid-frontal bone to the most prominent point of the occipital bone. The diameter = 11.5 cm Vertex is marked deflexion. Mento vertical: 14 cm Partial extension Brow Submentovertical Incomplete extension Face Submentobregmatic 5cm Complete extension Face

questions.text: A 60-year woman comes with 3rd-degree uterine prolapse. What will be the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair

questions.correct_answer: A. Vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair Uterine prolapse surgery is performed to remove the uterus and repair the weak tissue. Uterine prolapse frequently occurs in postmenopausal women who’ve had one or more vaginal deliveries. Here the woman is of old age (non-gestational) and has 3rd degree of prolapse. So best management of choice will be a vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair (Ward Mayo's operation).

Highyeild:

Sagging of the pelvic muscles which leads to uterine prolapse can occur: If supportive tissues are damaged during pregnancy and delivery. Due to estrogen loss as a result of straining repeatedly over the years (chronic cough, constipation etc.). Due to gravitational effects. Depending on factors like the age of the woman, desire for becoming pregnant and the overall state of a woman’s health, the treatment plan is decided.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

The management of prolapse depends on age: Young age: Sling surgery is Namely Shirodkar - preferred for those desirous of childbirth. Purandare (dynamic sling). Old age: Hysterectomy with repair. Ring Pessary: Early pregnancy. LeFort: Elderly, unfit.

questions.text: The major contribution of the amniotic fluid after 20 weeks of gestation:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Fetal urine

Highyeild:

There are two primary sources of amniotic fluid: fetal urine and lung liquid. After about 20 weeks , fetal urine makes up most of the fluid. Between 12-20 weeks fetal skin is the contributor to AF. Transudation of fetal plasma through the highly permeable fetal skin before it is keratinized at the 20th week. In early pregnancy (1 st trimester) it is by maternal plasma. Amniotic fluid volume is related to gestational age. It measures about 50 mL at 12 weeks, 400 mL at 20 weeks and is about 1 litre at 36–38 Thereafter the amount diminishes, at term, it measures about 600–800 mL further reduction occurs to the extent of about 200 mL at 43 weeks.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: What is the dose of ulipristal acetate?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

30mg

Highyeild:

Ulipristal (Ella) is a progesterone agonist/antagonist marketed for emergency contraception . It is available by prescription only. Its mechanism of action varies based on the time of administration. When taken before ovulation , ulipristal delays or inhibits ovulation. Administration in the early luteal phase may decrease the endometrial thickness and affect the implantation of a fertilized egg. Ulipristal is labelled for use as an emergency contraceptive following unprotected sexual intercourse or contraceptive failure. One tablet (30-mg tablet) taken as soon as possible, within 120 hours (five days) of unprotected sexual intercourse or contraceptive failure.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

Other emergency contraceptives: Levonorgestrel - 75 mg stat and after 12 hours Copper IUCD Mifepristone - 100mg single dose Ethinyl Estradiol - 5 mg BD * 5 days EE 50 mcg + norgestrel 0.25 mg - 2 tab stat and 2 after 12 hours

questions.text: The first line of treatment for mastitis in a lactating mother is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cloxacillin

Highyeild:

The beta - lactamase - resistant penicillins have been recommended in the treatment of mastitis. These include cloxacillin, dicloxacillin, or flucloxacillin. Because penicillins are acidic, they are poorly concentrated in human milk, which is also acid. Therefore, cloxacillin and its congeners tend to treat cellulitis well, but they are less effective in eradicating adenitis, the most likely precursor of breast abscess. When patients are allergic to penicillins, cephalexin or clindamycin may be the alternative to erythromycin. Combinations like co-amoxiclav should be avoided because of fear of inducing MRSA. Analgesics (ibuprofen) are given for pain. Milk flow is maintained by breastfeeding the infant. This prevents the proliferation of Staphylococcus in the stagnant milk. The ingested Staphylococcus will be digested without any harm.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: In low ovarian reserve, the anti-mullerian hormone level will be
questions.explanation:
Solution:

<1

Highyeild:

AMH and ovarian reserve AMH of 1.0 has a very poor ovarian reserve. The central concept for the measurement of blood levels of AMH to determine ovarian reserve is this: women with lower AMH levels have a lower ovarian reserve than women with high AMH levels. AMH is currently being used by fertility specialists to help predict women who may respond poorly to fertility medications and in general, couples who are less likely to be successful with fertility treatment. Expressed by the granulosa cells of small preantral follicles.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

AMH level ng/ml Effect on F ertility Treatment Above 1.0 Normal Value Good Possibilities for Treatment Between 0.4 - 1.0 Low value Below 0.4 Very low value Very few eggs at stimulation Pregnancy chance significantly lowered

questions.explanation:

Partial mole

The main types of gestational trophoblastic neoplasm are: Hydatidiform mole (complete or partial). Invasive mole - exclusively develops after molar gestation. Choriocarcinoma - mostly develops after molar gestation. Placental site trophoblastic tumo u r - mostly develops following a term gestation. Epithelioid trophoblastic tumo u r - rarest.

questions.text: Patients with recurrent abortion are diagnosed to have antiphospholipid syndrome. What will be the treatment?

options.label: C
options.text: Aspirin + Low molecular weight Heparin + Prednisolone

questions.correct_answer: B. Aspirin + Low molecular weight Heparin
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Aspirin + Low molecular weight Heparin

Highyeild:

Antiphospholipid Antibody Syndrome: Pro-thrombotic disorder can affect both venous and arterial circulations. Criteria include At least one otherwise unexplained fetal death at or beyond 10 weeks. At least one preterm birth before 34 weeks gestation because of eclampsia, severe preeclampsia, or placental insufficiency. At least three unexplained consecutive spontaneous abortions before 10 weeks. Patients should be tested for the presence of three factors: Lupus anticoagulant. Anticardiolipin immunoglobulin G and M (lgG and IgM) antibodies. Anti-Bz-glycoprotein I IgG and IgM antibodies. Management: Aspirin plus prophylactic anticoagulation with heparin throughout pregnancy and then for 6 weeks postpartum with either heparin or warfarin is recommended.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: Chromosome number of partial hydatidiform mole is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

69 XXY

Highyeild:

Partial Mole A partial hydatidiform mole is a triploid pregnancy with 69 instead of 46 chromosomes and another strange complication of the reproductive process. A partial hydatidiform mole can be identified by ultrasound showing placenta tissue, some hygromatous cysts, and some fetal oddities, but no clear fetus structure. Ultrasound is strictly an indicator. After spontaneous abortion or dilation and curettage, tissue needs to be examined by pathology and cytogenetics needs to be determined. If a triploid karyotype is determined as 69XXX, 69XXY, or 69 XYY, then a partial mole can be confirmed. Complete Mole Complete moles have a 46XX karyotype (85%), the molar chromosomes are derived entirely from the father. The ovum nucleus may be either absent (empty ovum) or inactivated which has been fertilized by a haploid sperm. It then duplicates its own chromosomes after meiosis. This phenomenon is known as Infrequently, the chromosomal pattern may be 46XY or 45X.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and C are false.

questions.text: Vulvar atrophy and itching are treated by?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Estrogen ointment

Highyeild:

Atrophic vaginitis, the medical term for this condition, occurs as a result of deterioration of the vaginal tissue. It’s a common condition in postmenopausal women because as estrogen levels drop , the tissue that lines the vagina becomes thinner and more easily damaged. Women with atrophic vaginitis may also experience vaginal itching, burning, frequent urination, or vaginal discharge. Women can treat this condition topically with estrogen creams, tablets (Vagifem), or an estrogen-releasing ring placed in the vagina (Estring). Oral estrogen, available with a doctor’s prescription, will also restore vaginal tissue. Vaginal lubricants offer an alternative for women wary of using estrogen. Moisturizers such as Replens, Astro Glide, and Lubrin can reduce symptoms and make sexual intercourse more comfortable.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: At 34 weeks gestation, the weight of the baby was 3kg. The child showing the following features may indicate which associated condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Diabetes

Highyeild:

Macrosomia is the term used to describe a large fetus. Macrosomia is associated with gestational diabetes and maternal obesity. The recommended definition is fetal (neonatal) weight exceeding two standard deviations or above. According to ACOG: a birth weight of > 4500gm is called macrosomia. In the Indian context birth weight of > 4000 gm is called macrosomia.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

Maternal hyperglycemia → Hypertrophy and hyperplasia of the fetal islets of Langerhans → Increased secretion of fetal insulin → stimulate carbohydrate utilization and accumulation of fat. Insulin-like growth factors (IGF-I and II) are also involved in fetal growth and adiposity. Elevation of maternal free fatty acid (FFA) in diabetes leads to its increased transfer to the fetus → acceleration of triglyceride synthesis → adiposity.

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding the physiological changes in pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Increase residual volume

Highyeild:

The respiratory rate is essentially unchanged , but the tidal volume and resting minute ventilation increase significantly as pregnancy advances. The functional residual capacity and the residual volume are decreased as a consequence of the elevated diaphragm. Total plasma protein increases from the normal 180g (nonpregnant) to 230g at term. However, due to hemodilution, the plasma protein concentration falls from 7g% to 6g%. Pregnancy is a hypercoagulable state. The fibrinogen level is raised. The cardiac output (CO) starts to increase from the 5th week of pregnancy and reaches its peak of 40–50% at about 30–34 weeks. Thereafter the CO remains static till term when the observation is made at the lateral recumbent position. CO is lowest in the sitting or supine position and highest in the right or left lateral or knee-chest position.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and D are true statements.

questions.text: Overt gestational diabetes is defined as fasting blood glucose more than?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

>126 mg/dl

Highyeild:

Overt diabetes is diagnosed as Random plasma glucose level >200 mg/dl , plus classic signs and symptoms such as polydipsia, polyuria, and unexplained weight loss. Fasting glucose level >125 mg/dl. Plasma glucose level >200 mg/dl, measured 2 hours apart with a 75 g oral glucose load (diagnostic).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and C are true statements.

questions.text: MgSO4 has no role in the prevention of?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

RDS in premature baby

Highyeild:

Magnesium sulfate (MgSO4) is commonly used as an anticonvulsant for toxaemia and as a tocolytic. Indicated to prevent seizures associated with pre-eclampsia, and for control of seizures with eclampsia. Agent for premature labour during the last half of pregnancy. The toxicity of I/V magnesium sulfate includes cardiac arrhythmias, muscular paralysis, respiratory depression and CNS depression in the mother as well as the neonate. Magnesium sulfate decreases the acetylcholine release from the nerve endings and reduces the motor end-plate sensitivity to acetylcholine. It also blocks the calcium channels. It causes vasodilatation and increases cerebral, uterine and renal blood flow. It decreases intracranial edema.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- . Options A, B and D can be prevented by the administration of MgSO4.

Extraedge:

It is contraindicated in patients with myasthenia gravis.

questions.text: Green frothy vaginal discharge is produced by?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Trichomonas vaginalis

Highyeild:

Trichomoniasis: It is a sexually transmitted disease. It is almost entirely a disease of child-bearing age. The vaginal discharge is frothy, slightly green in colour and profuse. There are multiple punctate strawberry spots on the vaginal vault and portio vaginalis of the Diagnosis: Culture is 98% reliable.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A: Herpes genitalis initially has red painful inflammatory areas over the clitoris, labia, vestibule, and vagina perineum. Multiple vesicles appear which progresses into multiple shallow ulcers and heal spontaneously by crusting. Option B: Candida albicans has pruritus vulva as the cardinal symptom. It is accompanied by vaginal irritation, dysuria and passage of thick curdy or flaky discharge.

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to OCP use?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

DVT

Highyeild:

Combined oral contraceptive pills Most effective mechanism: the inhibition of ovulation. Pearl index: 0.1/100 women years. Some benefits of Combination Estrogen plus Progestin Oral Contraceptives: Increased bone density. Reduced menstrual blood loss and anaemia. Decreased risk of ectopic pregnancy. Improved dysmenorrhea from endometriosis. Fewer premenstrual complaints. Decreased risk of endometrial (50%) and ovarian cancer (40%) (after 1 year of use). Reduction in various benign breast diseases. Inhibition of hirsutism progression. Acne improvement. Prevention of atherogenesis. Decreased incidence and severity of acute salpingitis. Decreased activity of rheumatoid arthritis. Absolute Contraindications: (A) Circulatory Diseases (Past or present) Arterial or venous thrombosis Severe hypertension History of stroke Heart disease: valvular, Ischemic Diabetes with vascular complications Migraine with focal neurologic symptoms (B) Diseases of the Liver: Active liver disease Liver adenoma, carcinoma (C) Others: Pregnancy Breastfeeding (postpartum 6 weeks) Major surgery or prolonged immobilization Estrogen-dependent neoplasms, e.g. breast cancer Relative Contraindications: WHO Category -2: (Advantages outweigh the risks) Age ≥ 40 years Smoker < 35 years History of jaundice Mild hypertension Gallbladder disease Diabetes Sickle cell disease Headache Cancer cervix or CIN WHO Category-3 : (Risks outweigh the advantages) Unexplained vaginal bleeding Hyperlipidemia Liver tumours (Benign) Breastfeeding (postpartum 6 weeks to 6 months) Heavy smoker (> 20 cigarettes/day) Past breast cancer

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

Pills are Associated with: Pituitary adenoma Reduced carbohydrate tolerance Migraine Thromboembolic disorders Cervical dysplasia» carcinoma of endocervix (after 5 years of use) Monilial vaginitis

questions.text: Which of the following statement is correct about the acute fatty liver of pregnancy?

options.label: B
options.text: Mostly seen in the last trimester

options.label: C
options.text: Common if the female fetus is present

options.label: D
options.text: May be associated with decreased uric acid

questions.correct_answer: B. Mostly seen in the last trimester
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mostly seen in the last trimester

Highyeild:

Acute Fatty Liver/Acute Yellow Atrophy Abnormal fatty acid oxidation. Bilirubin is moderately raised by 3-10 mg/dl. Presents in the third trimester . Presents with nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain and malaise. Patients may develop acute liver failure (encephalopathy, hypoglycemia, bleeding, renal failure, and death). Defect of long-chain 3 hydroxy acyl CoA dehydrogenase deficiency. Transaminases are highly raised. Management includes blood products, vitamin K, fresh frozen plasma, lactulose, and liver transplant. Immediately deliver. Common in male fetuses. Occurs in 1 in 10000 pregnancies. Associated with increased uric acid and creatinine.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: A double decidua sign is seen during
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1st trimester

Highyeild:

The double decidual sac sign (DDSS) is a useful feature on early pregnancy ultrasound to confirm an early intrauterine pregnancy (IUP) when the yolk sac or embryo is still not visualized. The double decidual sign consists of two echogenic rings surrounding the hypoechoic gestational sac. The inner ring represents the chorion, embryonic disc and decidua capsularis. The outer ring represents the decidua parietalis.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

Intrauterine GS should be seen by TVS when the maternal serum β-hCG level is 1,000–1,200 mIU/mL and by TAS with the level of β-hCG 6,000 mIU/mL. The presence of a yolk sac or fetal pole within the gestation sac confirms pregnancy. True gestational sac size increases by 1 mm/day. The pseudo gestational sac or pseudo sac is irregular in outline, usually centrally located in the uterus, has no double decidua sign and the sac remains empty.

questions.text: Nuchal translucency in USG can be detected at_____wks of gestation:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

11-13 wks

Highyeild:

Nuchal translucency is the normal fluid-filled subcutaneous space identified at the back of the fetal neck during the late first trimester and early second trimester. Component of first-trimester aneuploidy screening. Measured between 11 - 14 weeks.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

Extraedge:

Thickening of the nuchal translucency can be associated with: Aneuploidy (Down, Turner) Omphalocele Diaphragmatic Hernia Congenital Heart Disease VACTERL Syndrome
